strategy: debug: You are an ML research agent fixing bugs in a solution.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
def preprocess(data):
    # Fill missing Age values with median
    data['Age'].fillna(data['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
    
    # Drop rows with missing Embarked values
    data.dropna(subset=['Embarked'], inplace=True)
    
    # Encode categorical variables
    data = pd.get_dummies(data, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])
    
    # Drop unnecessary columns
    data.drop(columns=['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], inplace=True)
    
    return data

train_data = preprocess(train_data)
test_data = preprocess(test_data)

# Splitting the dataset
X = train_data.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train_data['Survived']

# Model training
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predicting
predictions = model.predict(test_data.drop(columns=['PassengerId']))

# Creating submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_data['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': predictions
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
def preprocess(data):
    # Fill missing Age values with median
    data['Age'] = data['Age'].fillna(data['Age'].median())
    
    # Drop rows with missing Embarked values
    data = data.dropna(subset=['Embarked'])
    
    # Encode categorical variables
    data = pd.get_dummies(data, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])
    
    # Drop unnecessary columns
    data = data.drop(columns=['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'])
    
    return data

train_data = preprocess(train_data)
test_data = preprocess(test_data)

# Splitting the dataset
X = train_data.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train_data['Survived']

# Model training
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predicting
predictions = model.predict(test_data.drop(columns=['PassengerId']))

# Creating submission file
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_data['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': predictions
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE
